page.title: 03FLORA OF THE S. DOWNS
page.content: All the common chalk-loving flowers are still found on Heyshott & Graffham downs. Nowadays they are mostly found on the edge of woods & paths. In dense conifer plantations light is sparse & nothing grows beneath the trees. Where trees have been felled, or young trees are growing, the flowers flourish. Less common downland flowers found during l985 on Heyshott Down are:- Orchids: Early Purple, Spotted, Bee, Fly, Marsh, Fragrant, Pyramid, Autumn Ladies' Tresses, White Helleborine, Twayblade. Less common bushes & shrubs found in l985 are: Wayfaring Tree, Wild Cherry, Dogwood, Wild Privet, Spindle, Buckthorn. Heather grows along the S. Downs way above Heyshott. The only place where the soil is acid enough. Wild rose, sweet briar & dog rose grow on Heyshott conservation area.
